metadata: (info { (description "Quechucague is a game played by the Mapuche people of Chile that has been documented since the seventeenth century. It appears to have been both a race game and a capturing game. ") (aliases {"Kechukawe" "Quechucayu" "Quechuncague" "Quechucan" "'Quechu"}) (rules "Semicircular board, ten spaces across the bottom, eight arcing, and three connecting the fifth and sixth in the bottom row to the fourth and fifth in the arc. Five-sided die with 1, 2, 3, 5, 0 as values. Captures are made when landing on a space occupied by the opponent. Race game. ") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "337") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/race/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Chile, from around 1646 to 1758.") } ) (graphics { (show Edges Hidden) (show Symbol "disc" Vertex (sites Board) fillColour:(colour 223 178 110) edgeColour:(colour Black) scale:0.9) })
